Articles.Content:
Squad have publicly stated that KSP is meant to be a game first, a sim second. Please keep that in mind.

While some of you may not all be overly impressed or even minorly happy with the aerodynamics changes that 1.0 (and the subsequent patches) that brought, it is important to remember one thing : You have many options that can be tweaked.

First of all, the physics.cfg found in the KSP sub-directory contains all of the options used to configure the new aerodynamics system in 1.0. All of them. You can change drag, lift, thermal, and mach options very easily. You can go back to the old souposphere. You can remove the atmospheres entirely.

Secondly, if physics.cfg doesn't contain the options you want, ferram4's Ferram Aerodynamics Reasearch (FAR or nuFAR) has a great deal of customization and even more realism available than the stock physics.cfg.

So please, before you post that thread complaining about how drag is too high, take a peek at physics.cfg and change the values around until you have what you want.

Picture of alt+f12 aero debug menu - change your physics values in-game until they're just right! Credit : sal_vager/
